charges.charge_description: On or about November 3, 2011, in Kansas City, Missouri, Jackson County, in the Western District, the defendants, did intentionally and unlawfully combine, conspire, confederate, and agree with each other, and others, to obstruct, delay and affect, and attempt to obstruct, delay and affect, commerce as the term is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, and the movement of the articles and commodities in such commerce, by robbery as the terms is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, in that, defendants did conspire with each other and others to steal property consisting of United States currency from 7-11, 11001 E. 23rd Street, Independence, Missouri, in the presence of Karl H. Schoenrade, against his will by means of actual and threatened force, violence, and fear of injury, immediate and future, to his person, that is, the defendants, used, carried and brandished simulated firearms during the demands for property, in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1951.

On or about November 3, 2011, in Kansas City, Missouri, Jackson County, in the Western District, the defendants, did intentionally and unlawfully combine, conspire, confederate, and agree with each other, and others, to obstruct, delay and affect, and attempt to obstruct, delay and affect, commerce as the term is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, and the movement of the articles and commodities in such commerce, by robbery as the terms is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, in that, defendants did conspire with each other and others to steal property consisting of United States currency from 7-11, 11001 E. 23rd Street, Independence, Missouri, in the presence of Karl H. Schoenrade, against his will by means of actual and threatened force, violence, and fear of injury, immediate and future, to his person, that is, the defendants, used, carried and brandished simulated firearms during the demands for property, in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1951.

On or about November 3, 2011, in Kansas City, Missouri, Jackson County, in the Western District, the defendants, did intentionally and unlawfully combine, conspire, confederate, and agree with each other, and others, to obstruct, delay and affect, and attempt to obstruct, delay and affect, commerce as the term is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, and the movement of the articles and commodities in such commerce, by robbery as the terms is defined in 18 U.S.C. 1951, in that, defendants did conspire with each other and others to steal property consisting of United States currency from 7-11, 11001 E. 23rd Street, Independence, Missouri, in the presence of Karl H. Schoenrade, against his will by means of actual and threatened force, violence, and fear of injury, immediate and future, to his person, that is, the defendants, used, carried and brandished simulated firearms during the demands for property, in violation of 18 U.S.C. 1951.
